I will keep working to lower costs, create jobs here at home, and ensure that folks across #NY19 have what they need.

1468599714014810118.text: "We would like to thank Congressman Delgado, Secretary Austin, and all of those who made our dream to see our brother, Charles Johnson receive the Medal of Honor a reality."

1468599712991387652.text: "Even as a child, Charlie’s kindness, generosity, and integrity touched everyone that he met. Despite our grief, we were not surprised that he would give his life to save others. The best heroes are ordinary people who accomplish extraordinary deeds."

1468599712055975941.text: "We have grieved the death of our extraordinary brother every day for nearly 70 years, hoping that someday his remarkable act of selflessness, patriotism, and courage would be fully honored and recognized."

1468599711095472139.text:
Please read these words from Charlie Johnson's remaining siblings:
 
"Our extraordinary brother Charlie 'Buddy' Johnson died as he had lived - thinking of others before himself."

1468599710017593350.text: Charlie Johnson was killed in action on June 12, 1953 while defending Outpost Harry. During the battle, Johnson ignored his own injuries and treated soldiers/dragged others to safety. He saved the lives of at least 8 men.

1243634769793081344.text: I will continue to advocate for working families, family farms, small businesses, including the self-employed, and everyone being asked to make immense sacrifices all across our upstate communities.

1243634769017143298.text: New York has become the epicenter of the COVID-19 pandemic and this legislation is by no means a panacea—but today the House took important, bipartisan steps to support those in need.

1243634768203386882.text: Additionally, as our family farms experience new challenges during an already difficult farm economy, we secured $9.5 billion in direct disaster assistance payments to aid our local producers during this public health crisis.

1243634767402328071.text: The emergency package passed today also includes my Small Business Repayment Relief Act, which automatically waives SBA loan repayments for up to six months.

1243634766458560515.text: This legislation includes critical support for every American worker, expanded unemployment insurance,  child nutrition to keep our young people from going hungry while out of school, & funding to support our hospitals as well as health care & essential workers on the frontlines.

1243634765544280064.text: #Coronavirus presents a challenge unlike anything our nation has seen before. Today I joined a broad bipartisan coalition in voting to pass emergency relief legislation to support upstate New Yorkers as we live through this global health emergency. THREAD: https://t.co/lwJcxYTc6o

1162461844814143489.text: Members of my staff met with Sullivan County Division of Public Safety officials to learn more about preparations for the Woodstock 50th anniversary. I appreciate the Counties’ work to prepare & ensure the safety & security of the thousands of anticipated guests to our region. https://t.co/wldKRiyTsj

1159900141886869504.text: Access to broadband is an economic necessity for Upstate New York and I am ready to work with partners on both sides of the aisle to make sure businesses, students, and communities in NY-19 are able to compete in the global economy.

1159900141052203014.text: I’ll be monitoring the FCC’s data collection improvements closely & continue to call for mapping procedures that accurately portray broadband availability in rural communities to address the #digitaldivide.

1159900140045553664.text:
The @FCC’s decision to end the flawed processes of census-block mapping technologies that over count rural communities and leave tens of thousands of Upstate New Yorkers behind is a step in the right direction.
https://t.co/fZRtmtC83H
